licence_overview:
$!Contact your local council for a skip permit if you want to put a skip on a public road.$!

In most, skip hire companies are responsible for getting skip permits. In some areas you'll need to do it yourself.

You need a permit for:

- skips
- hippobags and other skip bags

##Restrictions

You can't put a skip on the pavement. You don't need a skip permit if you're putting the skip entirely on private land.

You may need to put safety lights and markings (eg reflective markings or traffic cones) on or around the skip.

##Fines and penalties

If you don't put up the required safety lights and markings, you could be fined up to £1,000.
